Name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: Soviet – ISU-152
Description:
When you need big, bad and ugly it is hard to go past the ISU-152. This tank destroyer is designed to sit in a concealed position and destroy enemy tanks whilst being impervious to enemy fire thanks to a survivability stat of 2, Fortress, which helps to keep the tank safe when being shot in the side, and the benefits of being a Tank Destroyer which improves the tanks survivability when concealed. If there is one downside the ISU-152 it would be the relatively low initiative, but this can be improved by adding Situational Awareness to your radio operator.

—description from the publisher

Name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: American – M4A1 Sherman (76mm)
Description:
The M4A1 Sherman (76mm), much like it’s slightly less powerful brother, is one of the most recognizable tanks of World War II and can be counted on to perform reliably in almost any role on the battlefield. It bring a solid set of stats with a firepower of 5 standing out amongst the crowd meaning you can get away with little to no upgrades. Of course if you want to make a good thing better, then it is hard to beat a Vertical Stabilizer to give your tank an advantage on the move, whilst the Wright Continental R-975C4 engine that enhances your tanks initiative can benefit both M4 Sherman variants, as well as the “yet-to-be-released” M18 Hellcat (can someone say “spoiler”?).

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: World of Tanks Miniatures Game (Wargaming.net / GF9)

Name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: British – Churchill VII
Description:
The Churchill VII could never be confused for a race car but what it lacks in mobility it more than makes up with when it comes to a survivability stat of 3! The Churchill VII takes more to put down than an angry elephant! The Churchill VII is also very interesting as it comes with a couple of great options to enhance the tank to your specific needs. Swap out to a Churchill VI turret and reduce your firepower, but gain the Fortress rule, or upgrade the gun to the OQF 77mm Gun Mk. II to gain an additional firepower at the cost of some of your initiative.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: World of Tanks Miniatures Game (Wargaming.net / GF9)

Name: Vegetasaurus Rex
Description:
70 million years ago, the earth was inhabited by gigantic living beings known by humanity as dinosaurs. Among these magnificent specimens there was a group that liked to eat plants, they were herbivores. And among them, there was a small group. Four demanding dinosaurs when it came to food called Vegetasaurus. True gourmets who liked to combine plants to make their lunches more palatable.

Be the first dinosaur to prepare 3 recipes to close the game and get the best combinations of them to become Vegetasaurus Rex, the king of herbivores. But be careful with the Tyrannosaurus that prowls the grove, or you will have serious problems.



Hace 70 millones de años, la tierra estaba habitada por gigantescos seres vivos denominados por la humanidad como dinosaurios. Entre estos magníficos especímenes había un grupo a los que les gustaba comer plantas, eran los herbívoros. Y entre ellos, existía un pequeño grupo. Cuatro exigentes dinosaurios en lo que a comida se refería, que se hacía. llamar vegetasaurus. Unos verdaderos gourmets a los que les gustaba combinar plantas para hacer de sus almuerzos algo más apetecible.Sé el primer dinosaurio en preparar 3 recetas para cerrar la  partida y consigue las mejores combinaciones de las mismas para convertirte en Vegetasaurus - Rex, el rey de los herbívoros. Pero ten cuidado con el Tiranosaurio que merodea por la arboleda, o tendrás serios problemas.

Name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #87 – Gurkhas
Description:
Serving as part of the British Army for nearly 200 years, the Gurkhas have fought in almost every major conflict and theatre of war, including in World War II where they were comprised of 40 battalions. These fearsome Nepalese fighters have deservedly earned a near-legendary reputation of being some of the fiercest and bravest warriors in battle: esteemed by their allies and dreaded by their enemies, and respected by all alike. They are easily recognized by their signature weapon - the long, curved knife known as the kukri - and their motto is "Better to die than to be a coward."

This set adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII North Africa game, although the Gurkhas historically fought in every theatre of war and can be played with any Warfighter WWII setting. This set offers:

5 Gurkha Player Soldiers
4 Gurkha Non-Player Soldiers
5 Gurkha Squad Soldiers
1 Gurkha Squad Light Vehicle
3 Specialist Skills
1 Skill
2 National Skills
5 Weapons
28 Gurkha Hostiles
2 Events

—description from the publisher

Name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #88 – Desert Rats
Description:
The evocative nickname "Desert Rats" originated from the 7th Armoured Division, but later expanded to include all the Commonwealth troops - British, Australian, Indian and New Zealand - who fought and distinguished themselves in North Africa. This pack covers the fighting vehicles used by the Desert Rats, as well as featuring the same forces in an adversarial role.

This set includes 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII North Africa game, including:

2 Desert Rat Squad Light Vehicles
1 Skill
1 Gear
3 Action
3 Service Record Cards
44 Desert Rat Hostiles
2 Events

—description from the publisher

Name: Talento
Description:
A mediator chooses a photo and delivers 5 cards with phrases to each of the other players. Players choose one of the provocative phrases for the photo and vote for the best one. If your idea is the most creative, congratulations! You gained in talent. He is an advertising genius and gets points for that and a new round is held. The first player to reach a number of points wins.

—user summary

Name: nestorgames GP
Description:
nestorgames GP is a fast and furious racing game for 2 to 8 players, derived from Top Speed by the same designer, that simplifies many aspects of its predecessor (same mechanism, but using dice instead of cards) and also adds some fun twists such as special items or shortcuts. It is a tribute to the arcade racing games of the 80’s, such as SuperSprint or Nitro.

GAME OVERVIEW (please refer to the rulebook)

The player with the highest qualifying value goes first in the pit lane, with the rest of the players going in the same order as they are sitting and counterclockwise.

On your turn, if your car is belly up (you crashed on your previous turn) flip it over and pass the turn. You car doesn’t move.

Otherwise, roll one of your dice. Then you can opt to stop rolling dice on roll another one, and so on until you’ve either stopped rolling dice or you’ve rolled the same number twice. Notice that you can’t roll more than 6 dice.

One of these three things can happen:


     You’ve rolled the same number twice but the car is not on a corner: Your car does not move.



     You’re rolled the same number twice and the car is on a corner. You’ve crashed! (see Crashing) Your car does not move.



     You’ve stopped rolling so you don’t have repeated results: Add up all the values of the rolled dice and move your car forward exactly that many spaces along the track. Other cars don’t block your movement.


If your car moves and ends its movement on a non-corner space occupied by another car, you bump into it. Move that car one space forward. If, as a result, that car bumps into another car repeat the process. If a bumped car moves into a corner, it crashes (see Crashing). If there was another car (or more) on that corner then all of them crash on that space.

CRASHING: When a car crashes, flip it over belly-up, take one of its dice and place it on its ‘box’ by the side of the pit lane. You won’t be able to use the dice that are in your ‘box’ unless you Fix the car (see Fixing your car).

Races are usually played to 3 laps, but this can be agreed upon. The first car crossing the finish line after that many laps wins.

Additional rules include fixing your car (recover a die), using a shortcut once per race, picking up and using special items (bombs, wrenches, turbo boosters, rockets and oil spills), championships, teams,...

—description from the designer

Name: Twister-Jass
Description:
Twister-Jass is a new type of Jass for two people. The new Jass provides a lot of variety: because what seems to be a good hand can suddenly turn. Twister-Jass combines tactics, strategy and luck and was invented by a pirate."

Twister Jass is a new take on a traditional trick-taking card game. The goal is to score the most card points, but this is hard to do as the trump suit changes every third trick!

One player leads to the trick. The other player must follow the lead suit or may play a trump card. If a trump card is played, the highest trump card wins. Otherwise, the highest card in the lead suit wins the trick. The trump suit changes every third trick, determined either by a card flip or by a die roll (depending on how you choose to play).

The player who won the tricks with the most card points wins!

Name: Valenrelm
Description:
In Valenrelm you play as a kingdom that is competing for domination of the land. Start the game by choosing which kingdom you will play as and the tactic and specialty you will start off with. Tactics change the way your armies move on the map and specialties give you a bonus in one area. You can change these during the game as the world map unfolds changing situations require new capabilities.

There are two main decks that you draw from, the tile deck and the action cards. The tiles are used to explore the world and build the world map as the game progresses. This means the game has near infinite variation and no two games will ever result in the same world map. As you explore, you will encounter brigands who have come to inhabit the land of Valenrelm. Defeat them in battle and occupy the farms and villages they guard to expand your kingdom and gain the resources you'll need to recruit more armies and play action cards. Farms provide you with food while villages provide either iron, wood, or stone. There are also camps and castles that are used to recruit armies. The different types of armies have different abilities on the world map and are useful in different situations. Moving your armies on the map will allow you to conquer more territory.

Action cards are used to give you a temporary advantage over the other players. Most of the cards cost resources so having a steady supply of them is essential. Some cards affect your armies, some affect the armies of other players, some have negative effects. Using them at the right time could tip the balance of power and help you achieve victory.

When armies battle, the two players use their battle cards to play out the battle on the battlefield. Every player has the same battle cards unless they have chosen one of the specialized armies that has their own unique battle card. The cards are orders to the units in your army to perform a specific maneuver on the battlefield. The maneuvers each have their own offensive and/or defensive capabilities. Each player chooses their three cards for the center and left and right flanks and reveals the cards at the same time. You could order one of your units to charge at the enemy but if their unit used shield wall, the attack would be blocked. Another unit could flank the shield wall and defeat it. The battle mini games are quick, only lasting a minute or two. You could win, lose, or tie a battle. The result of the battle then effects what happens on the world map.

You can win by occupying most of the settlements, all of the castles, being very wealthy, or destroying everyone else's settlements. Valenrelm is a dangerous place where your fortunes could change at any moment. How will you forge your path to victory?

Name: BattleTech: Experimental Technical Readout – Liao
Description:
Experimental Technical Readout: Liao samples the custom and prototype designs that have begun to turn up in testing labs and top-secret proving grounds of the Capellan Confederation. Each design featured in this book incorporates some of the latest technologies developed by the realms of the Inner Sphere as the war against the Word of Blake continues.

These technologies--first described in Tactical Operations--have yet to achieve widespread production, but each has been prototyped and rushed to the field for their desperate consumers. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new experimental BattleMechs, vehicles, aerospace units, and battle armor designs presented in this book, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.

Name: BattleTech: Experimental Technical Readout – Marik
Description:
Experimental Technical Readout: Marik samples the custom and prototype designs that have begun to turn up in testing labs and top-secret proving grounds of the crumbling Free Worlds League. Each design featured in this book incorporates some of the latest technologies developed by the realms of the Inner Sphere as the war against the Word of Blake winds toward its final conclusion.

These technologies--first described in Tactical Operations--have yet to achieve widespread production, but each has been prototyped and rushed to the field for their desperate consumers. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new experimental BattleMechs, vehicles, aerospace units, and battle armor designs presented in this book, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.

Name: BattleTech: Experimental Technical Readout – Mercs
Description: Experimental Technical Readout: Mercs highlights a sample of the prototype designs that have begun testing in the BattleTech universe during the Jihad. Each design featured in this book incorporates some of the latest technologies to debut in the war against the Word of Blake, as first described in Tactical Operations. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new experimental BattleMechs, vehicles, and fighters, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.

Name: Random Fun Generator 2
Description:
Random Fun Generator 2 is a 76-page 7" x 10" B&W book that we're offering in both print and PDF. It's written by Sam Mitschke and Randy Scheunemann, and illustrated by Len Peralta, includes over 20 new dice games – all of which can be played with standard six-sided dice.

This is a stand-alone sequel to Random Fun Generator and can be enjoyed on its own. The original collection is not required to use these new games!
Families: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

Name: BattleTech: Experimental Technical Readout – Periphery
Description: Experimental Technical Readout: Periphery samples the custom and prototype designs that have begun to turn up in testing labs and top-secret proving grounds of the scattered realms of the local Periphery. Each design featured in this book incorporates some of the latest technologies developed by the realms of the Inner Sphere as the war against the Word of Blake winds toward its final conclusion. These technologies--first described in Tactical Operations --have yet to achieve widespread production, but each has been prototyped and rushed to the field for their desperate consumers. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new experimental BattleMechs, vehicles, aerospace units, and battle armor designs presented in this book, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.

Name: BattleTech: Experimental Technical Readout – Pirates
Description: Experimental Tech Readout: Pirates samples the custom designs that have appeared in the BattleTech universe during the Jihad. Each design featured in this book incorporates some of the latest technologies developed by the realms of the Inner Sphere in their war against the Word of Blake, as first described in Tactical Operations-deployed now by the malcontents daring enough to steal them. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new experimental BattleMechs, vehicles, and aerospace units, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.

Name: BattleTech: Experimental Technical Readout – RetroTech
Description: Experimental Technical Readout: RetroTech samples a number of new designs that have begun to emerge from secondary manufacturers across the war-torn Inner Sphere. Representing modern manufacturing with older techniques, most of the designs featured in this book incorporate a mix of modern technologies and older design standards--many rushed into service for their desperate consumers. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new experimental BattleMechs, vehicles, and aerospace units presented in this book, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.

Name: BattleTech: Experimental Technical Readout – Royal Fantasy
Description: Experimental Tech Readout: Royal Fantasy Tournament offers a complete list of the custom 'Mechs and battle armor devised for a special Solaris VII series of exhibition bouts with a familiar theme. Statistics, record sheets, and even pilot bios are included for 19 unique new experimental units, ready for play in (really) advanced BattleTech games set in the arenas of the Solaris VII Game World.

Name: BattleTech: Experimental Technical Readout – Steiner
Description: Experimental Technical Readout: Steiner samples the custom and prototype designs that have begun to turn up in testing labs and top-secret proving grounds of the war-torn Lyran Alliance. Each design featured in this book incorporates some of the latest technologies developed by the realms of the Inner Sphere as the war against the Word of Blake winds toward its final conclusion. These technologies--first described in Tactical Operations --have yet to achieve widespread production, but each has been prototyped and rushed to the field for their desperate consumers. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new experimental BattleMechs, vehicles, aerospace units, and battle armor designs presented in this book, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.

Name: BattleTech: Experimental Technical Readout – Succession Wars
Description: Experimental Technical Readout: Succession Wars, Volume 1 samples some of the desperate technological experiments that the war-ravaged powers of the Inner Sphere tinkered with during the post-Star League Succession Wars period. Each design featured in this book demonstrates the combination of regressing post-Star League technology levels on the BattleMechs, combat vehicles, and aerospace units that followed. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 14 BattleMechs, vehicles, aerospace units presented in this book, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.

Name: BattleTech: Dossiers – Lamenkov's Liability
Description: Lamenkov's Liability describes a lance of notable MechWarriors from the nascent Republic of the Sphere, highlighting their warriors, their machines, and their abilities both on and off the battlefields of the late 31st century. This Lance Pack dossier file provides players with the background and descriptions of all four members of the Liability lance and a micro-campaign based on their exploits, complete with character and BattleMech record sheets suitable for play with Total Warfare and A Time of War: The BattleTech Roleplaying Game.

Name: BattleTech: Dossiers – Salazar Tsakalotos
Description: Salazar Tsakalotos is one of many warriors who have emerged from the fires of war to join the ranks of the notable elite, forging his reputation and his destiny with the aid of his custom Thunderbolt. This dossier file provides players with the background and description of one of the BattleTech universe's upcoming elite, complete with character and BattleMech record sheets suitable for play with Total Warfare and A Time of War: The BattleTech Roleplaying Game. Bring Salazar into the battles of Lamenkov's Liability (CAT#35LP001A) for an even more legendary performance, or simply employ him in your own games as a valued ally--or a deadly foe.

Name: BattleTech: Dossiers – Youling Zhanshi
Description: BattleTech Dossiers: Youling Zhanshi describes a lance of notable MechWarriors from the Capellan Confederation, highlighting their warriors, their machines, and their abilities both on and off the battlefields of the late 31st century. This Lance Pack dossier file provides players with the background and descriptions of all four members of the Youling Zhanshi lance and a micro-campaign based on their exploits, complete with character and BattleMech record sheets suitable for play with Total Warfare and A Time of War: The BattleTech Role-Playing Game.

Name: BattleTech: Dossiers – Jason Zaklan
Description: Jason Zaklan is one of many warriors who have emerged from the fires of war to join the ranks of the notable elite, forging his reputation and his destiny with the aid of his custom Ti Ts'ang. This dossier file provides players with the background and description of one of the BattleTech universe's upcoming elites, complete with character and BattleMech record sheets suitable for play with Total Warfare and A Time of War: The BattleTech Role-Playing Game. Bring Jason into the battles of the Youling Zhanshi (CAT# 35LP02A) for an even more legendary performance, or simply employ him in your own games as a valued ally--or a deadly foe.

Name: BattleTech: Dossiers – The Bounty Hunter
Description: The Bounty Hunter Lance describes the notable MechWarriors who served alongside the Bounty Hunter during the early Jihad era, highlighting the abilities of these warriors and their machines, both on and off the battlefields of the 31st century. This Lance Pack dossier file provides players with the background and descriptions of all four members of the Hunter's lance and a micro-campaign based on their Jihad exploits, complete with character and BattleMech record sheets suitable for play with Total Warfare and A Time of War: The BattleTech Roleplaying Game.

Name: BattleTech: Era Digest – Age of War
Description: Era Digest: Age of War is a mini-sourcebook that explores the pivotal developments of the Sphere-wide fighting that ultimately led to the birth of the Star League, featuring a glimpse of life in the BattleTech universe before the age of the BattleMech, the rise of neo-feudalism, and a look at the evolution of combat from the savagery of ˆ_Ñ??total warfareˆ? to the chivalry of MechWarriors. Complete with rules and stats for several Age of War units, Era Digest: Age of War also features role-playing support for this crucial setting in BattleTech history!

Name: BattleTech: Era Digest – Golden Century
Description: Era Digest: Golden Century is a mini-sourcebook that describes the development of the Clans at their origin in a new series format, giving players a glimpse of early Clan life, the basics of Clan rituals, and a look at the rise and fall of Clan Mongoose. Complete with rules and stats for several Golden Century units--including the first OmniMechs--Era Digest: Golden Century also features role-playing support for this crucial period in BattleTech history!

Name: BattleTech: Era Digest – Dark Age
Description: Era Digest: Dark Age is a mini-sourcebook that explores the pivotal developments in the immediate aftermath of the HPG Blackout, giving players a glimpse at early reactions to the crisis and the rise of the splinter factions fighting to take advantage of the chaos. Complete with rules and stats for several Dark Age units, Era Digest: Dark Age also features role-playing support for this crucial setting in BattleTech history!

Name: Fais-toi une idée
Description: Fais-toi une idée is nothing like the classic puzzle game. Using a clue as well as a series of images, you have to make deductions and be creative to decode, with your team, as many puzzles as possible ... in 30 seconds flat.

Name: Microbrew: Sarsaparilla Promo Card
Description:
This promo card can be added to the thirsty customers deck. Doc Francis there loves Sarsparilla, which matches the “DMML” recipe in the base game -- the one with the scored out “perfect.”

He also will pay an extra $2 for any beer that is sweet. (He's offering the ORE-SOME style dollars, but we'll give him a 1 for 1 exchange rate because we're generous that way.)

Now mechanically speaking, Sarsparilla makes DMML slightly more valuable than it should be, so it’s not recommended in highly competitive play but it was just meant to be a fun little reference to our first game, ORE-SOME that we hope you enjoy.

—description from the publisher

Included with Kickstarter pledge rewards.

Name: Merchants Cove: Rogue Promo Card
Description:
Promotional rogue card made available through the Tantrum House Board Game Media: Season 8 Kickstarter campaign. And also through the Man Vs Meeple Season 4 Kickstarter Campaign.

When a Rogue enters the Lair, ALL players gain 1 Gold for each corruption card they have.

Name: Tatts
Description:
"Tatts" The Racecourse on the table is a simulated horse racing and gambling game from Australia published during the 1920's. Players consist of banker or " Bookmaker" and "Punters". The Punters place tokens or cash on the names of horses on the playing board. These horses are given "odds" to win. The Banker then gives a large pointer a spin which has the horses names on the board and when it comes to rest the pointer indicates the winner. The banker then pays the winner according to the odds marked on the board. Punters can back more than one horse or the top three winners.

From an Australian sporting perspective, Tatts has some historical interest. The horse names are Australian Champion Thoroughbreds from 1920 to 1921 with horse names synonymous in winning the richest races in Australia, such the Melbourne Cup, Sydney Cup, Caulfield Cup and Rosehill Guineas.

—user summary

Name: Rapture: New World Order Starter Box
Description:
That individuals with special abilities exist was discovered by Adam Weishaupt early on. He recognized the potential of his discovery and began to systematically track down the victims of witch hunts and provide them with a safe place to go into hiding. A secret society soon evolved from this undertaking, which Weishaupt called the "illuminati" and used to manipulate the balance of power in Europe to his advantage. 
When the Templars became aware of him, however, he saw himself forced to find a new place of refuge in North America, which was still shaken by the Civil War. Due to the change in government and the general unrest, it was much easier for Weishaupt to set up the secret society there that covertly intervenes in world affairs. Through the foundation of the "Council of 13", the New World Order was born.

Name: Alles Augsburg...?: Das Quiz
Description:
In this trivia game, one question and 4 answers about Augsburg are read out in turn. At least one answer is correct and at least one answer is wrong. The other two answers can be wrong or right. All players now guess which answers are correct. Each player can place at least one, but no more than 3, guessing stones. If you guess an incorrect answer, you do not win any points. All other players receive one point for each correct answer. The player who has collected the most points after an agreed number of questions wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Manolo Chess
Description:
The game is played on a round playing field with 4 x 16 squares. Due to the arrangement of the playing fields, some pieces have greater freedom of movement (queen, rook), while others are more restricted (bishop). The center line of the circle is defined as the baseline.
Otherwise, the usual rules of chess apply.

—user summary

Name: Ferner Osten DDR Würfelrallye
Description:
Players are divided into 2 groups, and each group should have an equal number of members with GDR knowledge. Each group starts with a "Trabbi" for a race, where by answering questions about the GDR, lucky coincidences, successful acting, etc. the journey can be accelerated. The winner is the group whose Trabbi reaches the finish line first.

—user summary

Name: Arcmage: Shadow Waves
Description:
The fourth core set of our libre fantasy style strategic card game Arcmage.

As you battle your opponents summoning creatures and casting spells, you’ll have to defend your cities, manage your resources and power supply and conjure up a strategical plan to beat your opponents. Will you be the one that brings order to the warring factions in Irdiya? Will you challenge all and utter the words ‘Amin duna, ilya lanta’?

This turn based game allows a player to gather resources, build cities, cast and move creatures, recruit an army, play magic spells or interrupt an opponents' play. Each turn the player may launch an attack on an a target city. On opponents' turns players may have to bravely defend their cities against the marauding enemy's army. Lose all of your cities and you're out of the game.

Following the tradition of many great CCG's, the game supports both casual as in depth strategic game play. Furthermore it offers an unique resource system and adds a spacial dimension that lets the player decide how and where to deploy their creatures.

—description from the designer

Name: Crisis at Steamfall: Genesis – Kickstarter Promo pack
Description:
64 promo cards unlocked during the Kickstarter campain.

27 Relic items cards
27 Workshop items cards
2 Crisis cards
8 Event cards

Name: Ninjajakten
Description:
Sneak out of the castle - without getting caught!
Now you have been at the Ninja school for a long time… You have trained a lot and your Sensei says that you are ready for the final exam: You will sneak around in the Ninja castle together, collect all the equipment a Ninja needs - and sneak out through the gate without Sensei catching your.

If you manage to do that, you will be approved Ninjas. But time is limited!

Exciting adventure games that require cooperation. You win or lose together!

You are a group of Ninja students at the Ninja School and have trained hard together to pass the final test to
become approved Ninjas. You should sneak around together
in school and find the various Ninja gear like your Sensei, hidden in the classrooms on school at the castle.
But you have limited time! You all have to have time to take you to the Ceremony Room and out of the castle before Sensei gets there, and besides, you must all have gathered at least
one Ninja gear each.
Be careful! If Sensei sees you (ends up in the same
room like you) then he punishes you by sending
back to the start box! Sensei has also placed
out cages you can get stuck in.
If you succeed, you have passed the test and will be approved
Ninjas. But if Sensei comes before you to the Ceremony Room. Then you have all failed…
But you can do the test again!

Name: Magiska monsterjakten
Description:
You and your friends must free your pets from the monsters!
Monsters have robbed your pets of your city. The adults have not been able to stop them, but now you and your friends have decided that it must be enough! You have figured out a way to disguise yourself as a monster and go into their villages to save your pets. You have to dress in the right color combinations - then the magic locks open!

The one who saves the most pets wins the game round and becomes the biggest hero in your city!

You start the game with 1-3 masking parts and changes / develops during the game by acquiring different parts: head, wings, tail, feet and so on. During the game, you may want to change the color combination on your masking parts depending on what colors the different magic locks to the villages have. Masking parts are placed in special squares on the board where you have to go to collect them.

If you have enough masking parts in the right color combination, you can open the lock to a village. For example, if one lock to a village have two red and one yellow square, you can get into that village if you have at least two red mask parts and at least one yellow masking member. You must hit the dice high enough to reach up to the red dice mark. You stay always on the red dice whether you have more steps left, then roll the dice again and move corresponding step into the village or castle. Each box has a number with plus or minus: add up all the numbers from the boxes you pass and land on - the sum is the number of animal tokens you can pick up.

Then to get into the castle, where you have a chance
To free most animals, you must have five masking parts with at least one part in each color (yellow, green & red) to get inside. This is the hardest to do, but you can also save the most pets here.

Name: Trolljakten
Description:
Escape from the trolls - before it's too late. A fun and exciting strategy game for everyone.
When you and your friends are out in the woods, you are taken by the evil mountain troll and his changes. Now you are stuck down in The troll mountain and have to get out before you are transformed into a troll - or something even worse…

There are two roads out, but both paths and bridges are in poor condition and full of holes. As a team, you must collect enough different cards so that you can change to your stone and wooden plank tokens to make a way out, and at the same time avoid being stopped by the trolls…. The exciting escape can begin!

In Trolljakten, each round consists of two parts - first a card part where you pick up new cards and then play as many cards as you want: fix roads, bridges, move trolls or change cards.

When you have finished the card, roll the dice and move one of the team's three game pieces.

The game is both exciting and fun. The more you play the more you discover the different strategies you can use to avoid the trolls, and be the first team to get out of the troll mountain.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Blood Bowl: Khorne Team – Skull-Tribe Slaughterers
Description:
Khornate Blood Bowl teams often find themselves at a disadvantage in leagues due to their inability to put scoring touchdowns ahead of goring their opponents. Against all odds, the Skull-tribe Slaughterers buck this trend, believing that the higher they rank in leagues, the better calibre of skull they will be able to claim for Khorne. As a result, the Skull-tribe Slaughterers have made their extremely bloody mark in the NAF as one of the greatest teams around.

Want a team that can both mutilate your opponent with ease, and score a good touchdown? Khorne teams have plenty of brawn and just enough brain to make it happen. Marauder Linemen are hardy enough to withstand plenty of punishment and smart enough to remember to pass the ball once in a match. Those who endure the brutal training regimes of Khornate teams become Bloodseekers. Impressively violent and single-mindedly bloodthirsty, they specialise in putting the opposition out of commission while offloading any erstwhile Blood Bowl balls to the team's Khorngors – houndlike Beastmen who are utterly intent on scoring touchdowns.

The multi-part kit is comprised of 64 plastic components with which you can assemble The Skull-tribe Slaughterers, a Khorne team for use in games of Blood Bowl. The team is made up of six Bloodborn Marauder Linemen, four Bloodseekers, and two Khorngor. This box also contains two double-sided Blood Bowl coins, two turn and re-roll markers, four Blood Bowl balls, and a transfer sheet with 222 symbols and icons to customise your team with. This kit is also supplied with 12x 32mm Citadel Round slotta bases.

—description from the publisher

Name: Blood Bowl (Second Season Edition): Khorne Team – Card Pack
Description: Redesigned for the Second Season ruleset, this deck of 44 cards will help you keep track of stats and profiles for your team, positions, and Star Players – plus Special Play cards exclusively for use with Khorne teams.

Name: Penguin Race
Description:
Be the first to bring your penguins to safety over the open sea before the ice bridges melt! The five bridges are made of real ice, so you have to put the mould for the bridge´s in the freezer before you play. There are two sets of moulds so you always have bridge´s to play with. You have to cross the bridge´s before they melt and collapses. If one bridge melts, take another way with a bridge still intact.
Sabotage by destroying strategic ice bridges by spraying water or pouring salt, or give your competitors a cold shower so they fall into the sea and start their hike again.

Two sets of bridges, so one can always be in the freezer!

A fun & different game that engages!

How the game is played:

The player that first moves their penguins across the ice to the goal has won. The other the team's start is your goal. But hurry up before the ice bridges are melting, and watch out for falling in the water!
Every time it's your turn, you should:

     Roll the dice, and possibly move a penguin.
     Pick up an event card.


Use one or two cards (your choice).

Name: Genialt frågespel: Logik
Description:
Are you a new Einstein… Or not…? Challenge your inner genius in this test of thinking outside the box. The answers can be surprising! You often have to think a little differently to defeat your opponents - to be first in the finish.

A player turns over the hourglass and reads the questions on the card. You must answer as many questions as you can before the hourglass is empty. You can move your game piece 1 step per correct answer, in straight lines (up, down, right, left), not diagonally. Two players can not stand in the same square.

To get into another player's dimension (part of the game board), you must be in a square adjacent to their dimension and answer a question correctly. The winner is the player who first enters another player's dimension.

Name: Blood Bowl: Second Season Edition – Khorne Pitch: Double-sided Pitch and Dugouts
Description:
This set contains a double-sided, fold-out Blood Bowl pitch and dugouts depicting the home stadium of a Khorne team. One side features the stadium in its standard skull-strewn conditions, and the other the same stadium when the teams have, temporarily, sated Khorne's thirst for violence.

The pitch is made to the same specifications as the board included with the Blood Bowl boxed game, and includes rules for play with each side.

Name: Blood Bowl (Second Season Edition): Spike! Journal #13
Description:
The exceptionally fierce Terrence "the Butcher" Iansson wipes the blood off his hands just long enough to guest edit this issue of Spike! Journal packed with eightfold treats. That's right, it's a Khorne special, focusing on those who play to appease the god of skulls.

Featuring 36 crimson-hued pages, this magazine covers the history, rules, and rosters of the Khorne team. Alongside all the tales of violence, violence, and more violence, you'll find the fantastic fun and essential commentary you've come to expect from Spike! Journal. As such, this magazine is the perfect companion for the savvy (and bloodthirsty) coach.

It includes:

     Blood for the Blood God: delve into the background and history of Khorne teams, the various player positions, Star Players, and a team roster.
     Famous Khorne Teams: what do Khorne's Killers, The Bloodsoaked Bruisers, The Flesh Hounds, and The Khornate Cripplers all have in common? They all donated an overwhelming number of skulls to Khorne this season, and they feature in this section covering the many teams that play for blood.
     The Skull-tribe Slaughterers Team Spotlight: a special in-depth article focusing on one of the few Khorne teams to reach the epiphany that winning games means more chances to claim better quality skulls. Includes a team profile featuring team colours, honours, Spike! team rating as well as the roster of their famous 2497-2498 squad, and loads more.
     Star Player Spotlight – Grashnak Blackhoof: a renowned Blitzer known as "The Great Black Bull" often considered one of the most violent players to ever grace the gridiron.
     Chat With the Rat: everyone's favour-best rat Hackspit Quillchewer takes the time to talk to the owner of the Khornate Cripplers, Overlord Kolgan Bloodrage, about their storied rivalry with the Slaaneshi Sidewinders.
     Star Player Spotlight – Scyla Anfingrimm: a wrecking ball of muscle on the pitch, Scyla's unique brand of violence has given him heaps of adoring fans and sponsorship deals despite no one knowing where he came from.
     Chaos Leagues: all-new rules and advice to help you run Chaos Leagues – a variant on the standard Blood Bowl League Season. The Cursed Skull Goblet is open to all teams, however each team participating must select one of the four Chaos Gods or Chaos Undivided as their patron. Includes rules such as a Wrath of Khorne Weather Table, Khornate Kick-off Table, unique post-game sequences, and special rules for the Altar of Khorne Blood Bowl Pitch and Khornate balls.
     Dirt From the Dugout: Mindy Piewhistle delivers another steaming hot pile of gossip, this time focussing on the underhanded means the Crimson Butchers have been using to convert rival fans into Khorne worshippers.
     Eviscerate and Exsanguinate: this is your guide to getting the most out of your skull-loving Marauders. Includes an overview of the strengths of the Khorne team (violence) positions, tactics (enacting violence), how to start out, and how to develop your team over a league, as well as examples of offensive and defensive set-ups. Surprising no one, Khorne teams prefer offence.
     Star Player Spotlight – Max Spleenripper: innovative and skilled with a chainsaw, Max has become a must-have player in Khorne teams and a household name. Find out how he earned the name 'Spleenripper' right here.
     Ask Lord Borak: curious Blood Bowl fans have their questions answered by the fearsome Lord Borak.
     Coffin Corner: plenty of players have lost their heads over the years, pleasing Khorne greatly. This regular column remembers those who died, willingly or not, in tribute to the Blood God.
     Mighty Blow! – New Brawls Please: this comic takes a look back at one of Bob Bifford's games against a Khorne team.

Name: Picky Kitty
Description: Spin the spinner to see what to feed the kitty. But be careful...give him too many veggies and he will flip his plate! Be the first player to feed the kitty all of your vegetables without the kitty flipping your veggies to win!

Name: Most Cutest
Description:
Is Amy Doghouse cuter than Authur the baby rhino? What about Meatball the Meerkat? It’s all relative as you take turns picking the Most Cutest animal around, and trying to guess how the other players voted.

Gameplay is simple; draw a series of adorable animal cards face up onto the table, and take turns being the cuteness critic, secretly choosing which you think is the cutest. Then the other players take turns guessing your choice and earning points along the way.

—description from the designer

Name: Welcome to Real Vegas
Description: Bring home the excitement of a Las Vegas casino in a board game. Players work their way around the board as a group and play all the great casino games including Poker, Blackjack, Roulette and Craps.  The winner is the player who has the most money when the first person crosses the finish line.

Name: Turf War: Fantasy Theme Pack
Description:
The Fantasy Theme Pack expands the base Turf War with a set of fantasy-themed cards to replace each player's starting cards, as well as 5 new fantasy-themed Neighbor cards that can be shuffled into the Neighbor deck.

The re-themed cards include 2 "Treasure Chest" Piggy Banks, 2 "Dragon's Hoard" Piggy Bank Tracks, 2 "Castle / Adventure" Home / Away cards, 2 "Throne Room" Garages, and a "Dungeon" Trash card.

—description from the publisher

Name: Ecosystem
Description:
A cooperative ecology-themed board game for having fun with friends and relatives and learning to respect the environment!

The aim of the game is to clean up the earth and help to safeguard its natural beauty: by extinguishing fires, reducing smog and pollution in our cities and clearing waste from the oceans.

The game relies on cooperative rules to remind the family about the importance to take care of our planet all together.

The aim of games of the Play for Future range is to help everyone understand the importance of sustainability and respect for the environment through play.

Conceived, designed and developed in Italy.

Name: Thunderstone Quest: To the Barricades
Description:
To the Barricades - the Kickstarter Reward - included two Quests and the really big box plus the Barricades mode components.

Barricades mode - the retail product - includes just the Barricades Mode components and comes in a small box.

Name: Open Portals
Description:
Open Portals is a deck of 56 fully illustrated playing cards that also comes with a manual that teaches players how to play a new and inventive multiplayer card game. Open Portals also doubles as an Oracle deck.
—description from the designer

The game is a decorated standard deck of cards, with four suited jokers. The object of the game is to get the most points, and you get one point for each Portal (number card) Opened (in front of you at the end of a round), as well as some bonus points. Each player is dealt 14 cards and then cards are passed until every player has one Magic (Ace) card. Then each players particular Magic card is played down to show their suit. Each turn you may play one card in front of you. God (face) cards are special action cards that let you take the action listed on it when you play it. Portals may only be Opened if the suit matches your Magic card. Once a Portal is Opened, you may Open Portals of others suits matching that Portals numbers too. And if you play a Myth (Joker) card in front of you, you can then Open Portals matching that Myth card too. A round ends once all God cards have been played. The winner is the first person to 36 points, or whomever has the most points after 3 rounds.

—user summary

Name: Competing Cat Castles
Description:
Four kingdoms exist, in the four cardinal directions of the map. The snow leopards in the mountains to the north, the jaguars to the east in the plains, the tigers to the south near the jungle, and the lions to the west in the grasslands. These four kingdoms have been at war for as long as can be remembered - and they’ve built nuance to their battle plans over centuries. Can you lead your Kingdom to victory?

Competing Cat Castles is a game of deduction, risk, and luck for 2-4 players. Your goal is to win more competitions than your opponents. Each round you will select one of the nine cards representing the key players in each kingdom. Every cat plays a part, from the Monarch down to the youngest baby. Several of these key players have abilities that can hinder your opponent, or boost your next turn. Players play their chosen cat face down and reveal them simultaneously. The cat with the highest power wins, after any abilities have been applied.

Keeping track of who your opponents have played and who you have to counter them will lead to victory, but never discount luck.

—description from the designer

Name: Esopya
Description:
Esopya is a card game for 1-4 players. It is played on a tactical board and the purpose of the game is to defeat the rival kingdom by summoning creatures that move across the battlefield or by casting powerful spells.

Esopya is also the name of a fantasy world. During its ancient history, many different civilizations were born: Elves, Dwarves, Humans, Vampires, Ogres, Sorcerers and so many others.

From the planet, it is possible to assimilate a very powerful energy source: Mana.  It is a resource that allows people to grow and dominate others. Some defend their sources, others seek for new ones.

You can build your own deck, with your own tactics, or play with a ready-to-play one.

—description from the designer

Name: Masters of Crime: Rapture
Description:
White sandy beaches, the gentle sound of waves, and a well-functioning drug cartel: this is what the "Isla de Cubaidos" is known for — that, and its international superstar Dayana.

But for you, the Caribbean paradise could soon become hell because the secret drug network that you have built up on the island is threatened by a public scandal: Dayana has disappeared on the island without a trace. Can you find out what happened to her before the police search party arrives and inspects your island?

Masters of Crime: Rapture is a co-operative deductive murder mystery game in which players must solve puzzles, follow clues and make decisions to solve a case. They do this using the included deck of cards, twelve hidden realistic clue documents, and the Internet. Through a choose-your-own-adventure mechanism, players make decisions that influence the course of the game and lead to solving the case in the end. One by one, they enter different realistically designed locations and encounter the various suspects. Then they choose from three different ways to deal with the situation and receive points based on their decisions. Complex puzzles and escape room elements must be solved in order to progress further in the case.

The game is closely intertwined with the real world, and players have to keep using traditional apps like Google Maps or Wikipedia to gather information. Email, detailed web pages, and cell phone calls are also part of the immersive gaming experience.

Name: Frankfurt-Spiel
Description:
This game may be played in several different ways:

     Frankfurt-Spiel (roll and move game with event cards),
     Jahresereignisse sammeln (1. with collecting fact cards)
     Quartette sammeln (2. with collecting sets of fact cards)
     Strategisches Quartette sammeln (like 3., but the 1st to get one set of cards wins)
     Frankfurt-Quiz (quiz card game)
     Frankfurt-Quartett (card game)
     Joker-Quartett (6. with joker cards)
     Frankfurt Rommé (card game)


The game was published in 1977 as a promotional boardgame for the "Stadtsparkasse Frankfurt".

—user summary

Name: Zombie Bus: Le raton laveur
Description:
Upon arrival, the raccoon immediately loses an item of equipment for each player who owns it (of your choice).

Then at the start of each turn, and as long as it remains in play, he eliminates a random token from the equipment pile.

Note: if both the raccoon and the squirrel are in play, the raccoon immediately joins the squirrel on the active player! It will remain on that player until it is eliminated.

A son arrivée, le raton laveur fait perdre immédiatement un équipement à chaque joueur qui en possède (au choix).

Puis au début de chaque tour, et tant qu'il reste en jeu, il élimine un jeton au hasard de la pile des équipements.

Note : si le raton laveur et l'écureuil sont tous les deux en jeu, le raton laveur rejoint immédiatement l'écureuil sur le joueur actif ! Il restera sur ce joueur jusqu'à son élimination.

Name: SUM8
Description:
SUM8 is a two player tile based, puzzle-like strategy game with a rearrangeable board, unique tile design and extreme re-playability.

The gameplay is simple: you play against your opponent, each player starting with 8 tiles. In alternating moves you create circles and then eventually '8's in a puzzle like sequence to score points to victory, but don't give your opponent the opportunity to score big!

On their turn, players place a tile onto the board, or move an already placed tile on the board to a new spot. This will give the player points based on what / where they place the tile.

The game ends when all tiles are played, or no one is able to place or move a tile. The player with the highest score wins!

Name: Pippi Langstrumpf Pantomime
Description:
This is a charades/pantomime game for 2 groups. Every group gets some cards with nice images of Pippi and her friends and explains the  words on the cards to the other group without any words, but just gestures.

The group which recognizes the most cards win.

Name: Familou
Description:
During the game, players can discuss with each other what cards they have (but do not show the cards). The object of the game is to lay down cards that help the next player to lay down their hand so that the game is not interrupted. If you can;t, then you must turn over 1 of the wolf cards.

If the players folded six cards from each of the seven families, they won. Conversely, if all six wolf cards are turned over, the wolves win and the players lose the game!

Name: Pippi packt ihren Koffer
Description:
This is an interesting memory game for 2-4 children.

All children have a look at the 34 cards and try to memorize them. Then the cards are shuffled and put face down on the table. The youngest child starts and says what s/he wants to put in their bag and turns one card face up. If s/he is lucky, and the card shows the correct image, s/he puts it in their bag. If not, s/he has to turn the card face down again and it's the next player's turn. The child with the most stuff in his bag when the tiles are all picked, wins

Name: Nachbars Kirschen
Description:
It's no cinch getting to the delicious cherries in the garden of Mr. Scrooge, the next door neighbour, because 2 dogs are keeping a watchful guard over the cherry tree. Only a child who really knows how to use a fishing line can outwit the guard dogs and hang the pair of cherries he's caught over his ears.

The game is constructed in a box with wooden cherries in pairs attached to strings inside.  The is also one pair of dogs attached to strings in the box.

Children take turn using the wooden fishing pole to hook the cherries - avoiding the dogs. The game ends when the cherries run out.  The child who hooks the most cherries wins.  If a child hooks the dogs, the game stops and they lose.

Name: Dicke Fische
Description:
Big fish is a learning game for 2-6 children and requires the ability to observe well and guess the correct range of the fishing net.

Capt'n Catchem, the smart fisherman, is sitting in his small boat and is casting the fishing net again and again. Whoever can help him to move his boat to the right point and catch many fresh fish, will be rewarded with a big catch.

The game is played on the floor or table, the fish are randomly distributed, a minimum distance of 5 cm. In your turn you choose a fish and place the boat where Capt'n Catchem can catch the fish. The fish is caught when it lies in the ring without contact, the boat must not touch or move any fish, the tip should point in the direction of the selected fish, if the boat is set, it is no longer allowed to change its position. When all fish have been caught, the winner is whoever has the longest row when the fish are next to each other.

Name: Ship Adventure
Description:
Do you want to explore cities, temples, jungles and islands? Hunt treasures and a lot of gold? Fight pirates and players? Go for an epic conquest of the Caribbean? Then Ship Adventure is made for you! The board of Ship Adventure is made of 36 tiles that allowed an unimaginable number of board combinations to make each playing experience unique.

Ship Adventure is a 2 games in 1 with a treasure hunt mode and a conquest mode.

In Ship Adventure - Treasure Map, players move their ship and crew on the board, choosing the quickest itinerary to reach cities, temples, treasure tokens and pieces of treasure map. Along the journey, they are going to purchase equipment to boost their ship so they perform better score when launch their dice during fights. The game end when a player has gathered the 4 different pieces of treasure map and has reached the coordinates indicated on the puzzle formed by the 4 pieces on the board.

In Ship Adventure - Caribbean Conquest at each turn player move their fleet and armies on the board in order to take the control over strategic points. Each strategic points gives gold coins at the end of the turn which are used to purchase equipment and new units. The game ends when a player controls the majority of the strategic areas or when a player has been eliminated.

Name: The Greatest Investor
Description:
The Greatest Investor is a turn-based strategic card game with the ultimate goal of building the most valuable portfolio. The person with the highest-valued portfolio of assets can claim the title of The Greatest Investor.

The players take turns drawing an asset and an event card, whoever acquires the highest value in assets, best profiting from economic events, becomes The Greatest Investor ever. The game ends when the event deck is depleted

Although the game is easy to learn, that doesn’t necessarily mean becoming The Greatest Investor is simple. With each event card drawn by ANY player, your portfolio of assets may be decimated. So, the longer you play, without going bankrupt, the higher the stakes.

—description from the publisher

Name: Lese-Polizei: Einsatz in Wimmelstadt
Description:
Alarm in Wimmelstadt! A gang of thieves is roaming the streets and squares, stealing everything they can get their hands on.
This is a case for the clever reading police! They quickly have a look at the city and follow the clues read to them by the head of police. He tells them where they can find an important witness, a partner in crime, or a crime scene. With these clues they can find the perpetrators and the loot.

Listen carefully and look closely, and you can find the clues you're looking for, with a bit of luck, you can catch all the bags from the robbery boss and stop to the thieves. But beware: if the boss of the thieves has most of the loot in his hiding place, the thieves have won.

This game playfully promotes reading and listening skills
of children in preschool and first reading age. Since the game also requires close observation, it also improves the ability to concentrate.

Name: Mäuse-ABC
Description:
This game consists of 6 small games for children to start learning letters and reading.

Game 1 - Insert letters:
The children insert letter tiles in the correct alphabetical order in the frame. This can be controlled with the ABC board. For correct letters, the kid gets a mouse cards and the one with the most mouse cards wins at the end of the game.

Game 2 - Arrange letters
The letter tiles are put face down in the frame above the ABC board according to color. The starting kid roles the dice and one letter card of the corresponding colour is revealed which s/he needs to put in the correct place.

Game 3- Guessing letters
The letters are put unordered in the cheese frame, underneath is a template sheet (inserted by a child as the game leader). Whoever thinks they can guess the letter quickly puts their mouse on it.

Game 4 - Search for a word
The letters are placed face down in the frame. The game master selects a word from the word list and the children try to find the letters of this word.

Game 5 - Reveal a word
The letters of a word from the list are to be found and uncovered in one go, everyone has to remember all the uncovered letters and their places.

Game 6 - Find a word
Words are to be formed from the revealed letters. The children can use the word list to help them.

—user summary

Name: Wer zuletzt lacht...
Description:
In this card game, every player gets five cards. During his turn, each player put one card face up in front of him. For every smiling face, he gets a chip and puts it on his card. For every sad face, he can take a chip from another player. 
The player with most chips wins.

—user summary

Name: Sagrada: Promo 16 – CuseCon 2021 Window Pattern Card
Description: A new promotional, double-sided window pattern card distributed at CuseCon in 2021.

Name: Castle of Mind for Kids
Description:
Castle of Mind for Kids is the little sister of the Castle of Mind board game, designed to be played with kids from preschool and challenge even older ones. It's an exciting two-person strategy board game in which players are the first to try to get their lion to the cliff in the middle of the board by controlling various animal discs. Its rules are easy to learn, the gameplay is fast, the playing time is approx. 5-15 minutes. Perfect for an introductory strategy board game.

The game board indicates where in the starting position the two players can place the discs for each animal. Once each animal disk is in place, the starting player moves one of their animal disks to a neighboring space. Players cannot move diagonally with their animal discs. Any animal can enter any field, but only a lion can enter the middle red field. Players take turns moving their discs, and if the animal moves to a square of the same color (corresponding to its habitat), it can chase an opponent's animal that is on a square of the same color.

There are several ways to win: players get their lion to the cliff, or chase the opponent’s lion. Or, if our opponent can’t take a valid move, we win.

Players need to be very forward-thinking and attentive, keeping an eye on the entire board to protect our animals while moving with them and our lion. It is an enjoyable logic-strategy board game that can be taken out again and again, which perfectly develops logical thinking, the ability to plan ahead, the ability to combine, the concentration of attention and social skills.

Name: Stormsunder: Bones of the Conquered
Description:
Continue the Stormsunder: Heirs of Ruin core game adventure with the Bones of the Conquered expansion with hundreds of hours of new gameplay!

This expansion contains more than 136 minatures, 1300 cards and a 300-page campain book!

Name: Stormsunder: A Pharaoh's Wrath
Description:
Continue the Stormsunder: Heirs of Ruin core game and Bones of the Conquered expansion adventure with the A Pharaoh's Wrath expansion with hundreds of hours of new gameplay!

This expansion contains more than 110 minatures, 1500 cards and a 300-page campain book!

Name: Stormsunder: The Faceless Expansion
Description:
The Faceless expansion adds the Faceless as an additional faction to Stormsunder as a way for players to increase the difficulty of their adventure. Early on in the story, the heroes will cross paths with the Faceless and be hunted by them throughout their journey. The Faceless may arrive one or two at a time during an encounter to harass the heroes, or they may attack in full force after the heroes are already weary from combat. Regardless, the Faceless present a unique challenge for players to choose to embark upon. If you want a challenge, this is the way to go.

The Faceless Expansion includes:
- 13 Faceless Miniatures (Bakeal x1, Faceless Negator x3, Faceless Abolisher x3, Faceless Obliterator x3, Faceless Nullifier x3).
- 103 Adversary, Equipment and Other Cards.
- 48-Page Campaign Book.

—description from the publisher

Name: Stormsunder: Wayward Squire Expansion
Description:
The Wayward Squire expansion adds Lady Aylwen, Phelt and Frank to the world of Stormsunder. Hailing from the Tulion Wastes from a far away land, the valiant knight, her lazy squire and his adorable decoy are traveling from world to world, desperately trying to get home. Lady Aylwen and Phelt are new Wayward heroes with their own story arc that can be added to your Stormsunder campaign. Frank doesn’t have his own story to tell, but is made with a small amount of explosives, so feel free to stand between him and some vampires.

The Wayward Squire Expansion Includes:
- 3 Miniatures (Lady Aylwen x1, Phelt x1 and Frank x1.
- 198 Hero, Skill and Other Cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Suffrage
Description:
Become a leader of the women’s suffrage movement demanding votes for women! Be inspired by history or choose a different path as you conduct actions,  grow the movement of supporters and ultimately win the vote!

Suffrage is a card based board game about the iconic and pivotal struggle for women’s suffrage in early 20th century Britain and Ireland. Each player takes the role of one of six historical women, all interesting and important personalities in the movement. The goal of the game is to acquire a large enough movement and persuade enough male MP’s over at Parliament to support the cause of votes for women. The game consists of 110 cards and 60 custom suffrage supporter miniatures.

On each turn, players choose 1 of the available action cards. Depending on what kind of action is chosen, some supporters will join the movement, while others will leave. Suffragettes for example will gladly join the cause, planting bombs and conducting sabotage, while Suffragists instead support peaceful actions, slow and steady. Similairly, the upper class women and the working class women support - and reject - different actions. It is up to the player to choose which path is most efficient, based on the available action cards.

Once a large enough movement is gathered, the player goes to the Parliament, where - based on the size of the movement - a certain number of MP's (Members of Parliament) will either vote YES or NO to the demand of women's right to vote. A player wins the game by getting at least 10 YES votes.

Name: Stormsunder: Stretch Goal Box
Description: The Stretch Goal Box will hold all Stretch Goals reached during the crowdfunding of Stormsunder. List in Wiki section.

Name: Auksinis protas: BLITZ
Description:
"Golden mind. BLITZ is a fast and fun board game based on the Golden Mind TV game show. An intelligent board game will make you feel not only a participant in a popular TV show, but also its host.

Players ask each other questions from 108 question cards with five question categories in each: multiple choice questions, a chain, an open question, and a yes or no quiz. The goal is to collect as many rubies as possible than your opponents and become not only the smartest but also the richest winner.


„Auksinis protas. BLITZ“ – greitas ir linksmas stalo Å¾aidimas, sukurtas pagal TV Å¾aidimÄ… „Auksinis protas“. Intelektualus stalo Å¾aidimas leis jums pasijusti ne tik populiariosios TV laidos dalyviais, bet kartu – ir jos vedÄ—jais.

Å½aidÄ—jai vieni kitiems uÅ¾davineja klausimus iš 108 klausimÅ³ korteliÅ³, kuriose yra net po penkias klausimÅ³ kategorijas: klausimai su atsakymo variantais, grandinÄ—lÄ—, atviras klausimas bei taip ar ne viktorina. Tikslas - kuo greiÄiau uÅ¾ varÅ¾ovus surinkti kuo daugiau rubinÅ³ ir tapti ne tik protingiausiais, bet ir turtingiausiais nugalÄ—tojais.

Name: Freakz in the Sheetz: Vol. 1 Starter Pack
Description:
How would you react if you woke up with a Sheetz tattoo? What if you made an M*T*O Burger so big you couldn’t fit it in your mouth? Find out in this hilarious adult (13+) party game! Compete with your friends to see who will be crowned Freak of the Memez by matching Pic Cardz with Caption Cardz, and creating your own Sheetzy meme combos.

Uses What Do You Meme? game mechanics. Each round, one player takes the role of judge and plays a photo card, after which everyone else plays a caption card to complete the meme. The judge decides the funniest pairing, and whoever played the winning caption card wins the round.

Name: That Time You Killed Me: Consumption Promo Pack
Description:
A promo envelope full of secrets for That Time You Killed Me. 
Directions on when to open the envelope and what to do with the contents will be revealed to players when they reach the Coda of the campaign.

The envelope contains 5 cards - 1 flavor text card (P.1) and 4 Temporal Powers (P.2, P.3, P.4 and P.5)

Name: Dead Machine Gods
Description:
Dead Machine Gods is a strategic cyber-occult worker placement and tableau building mint tin game for 1-2 players. Set in a world of dark magic, occult technology, and haunted machinery.

Gather resources, research and build arcane blueprints, and complete the rites of summoning to resurrect ancient mecha-deities. Will you appease the ancient ones or succumb to their grim will and embrace the call of annihilation?

In each round of Dead Machine Gods, players will roll all their worker dice, and take turns placing workers on available card slots based-on their rolls. Placing workers lets you gather energy, material, and blueprints for building out your tableau.

The game ends when the first player completes their 8-card tableau (completing the rites of summoning). Players then tally the base victory points on the cards in their tableau as well any additional points earned form card abilities, placement synergies, and special symbols. The player with the highest score, wins.

Name: Dribble
Description:
Can You Master The Dribble? Patience and dexterity are needed to conquer this unique challenge. The further you get the ball from one end of the twisting pegs to the other without the ball falling through, the higher your score. Use the larger glass ball or the smaller, more difficult metal ball.

This dexterity game consists of a long wooden board with 4 squares marked out with point values.

Attached to the board are two parallel wooden rods, slightly above the scoring squares. The rods have smaller offset spokes attached in a spiral that move the ball along as the rods turn.

Players must attempt to join the spokes on both rods making the ball roll "uphill" before it drops into a scoring square. The player with the most points wins.

Name: Kereszt és Félhold
Description:
Kereszt és Félhold (Cross & Crescent) is an abstract-style battle game for 2 or 4 players. It was designed to reenact battles between the Ottoman army and the allied Christian forces in the 16th and 17th centuries. Gameplay is entirely based on strategy, with zero luck factor. In the case of 4 players, the game becomes semi-cooperative; two commanders are in charge of the same army forces, but the winner will be the one with the higher score on the winning side.

Each round consists of two phases. In the first phase, players prepare for their planned operations behind the screens. The second phase is the combat itself, when the pre-defined commands are executed. The game ends when 50 victory points are achieved by any of the parties.

Both armies are controlled by means of troop cards, which govern the operations of the “troop towers” representing the specific army corps on the board. Troop cards are double-sided: turning them over, players can develop troop capabilities and unlock more advanced features. The available options for movement and combat are determined by troop capabilities and terrain conditions. Certain terrain structures (such as bridges and tranches) can be built during the battle.

The rulebook includes 4 real battle scenarios, but the modular board allows players to set up a custom play area, giving the game unlimited replay potential. 


A Kereszt és Félhold 2 vagy 4 fÅ‘s absztrakt harci játék, mely az európai szövetséges seregek és az oszmán hadak közötti,  XVI-XVII. századi csaták újrajátszásához ad kereteket. A játék teljesen szerencsementes. Négy játékos esetén 2-2 kapitány irányítja ugyanazt a sereget, azonban együttmÅ±ködésük félkooperatív:  játék végén a gyÅ‘ztes sereg nagyobb pontszámmal rendelkezÅ‘ kapitánya nyeri meg a játékot.Minden forduló két fázisból áll: az elsÅ‘ fázisban a hadmÅ±veletek elÅ‘készítése zajlik a paraván takarásában, a második fázisban pedig a parancsok teljesítése, azaz maga az összecsapás. A játék addig tart, amíg valamelyik fél el nem éri az 50 pontot.

A táblán a lépés- és támadáslehetÅ‘ségeket az egyes hadtestek képességei, illetve a terep egyszerre befolyásolják; bizonyos terepelemek (pl. híd vagy sánc) a harc közben is építhetÅ‘k.

A szabályban 4 korabeli összecsapás szerepel, de a moduláris tábla lehetÅ‘séget biztosít egyéni játéktér kialakítására is, így szinte végtelen újrajátszhatóságot kínál.

Name: Men
Description:
Men (Egyptian: Mn) is a 5,000 year old game from ancient Egypt. It is roughly contemporaneous with Mehen and Senet. One of the most mysterious of ancient games, only two partial boards have been discovered by archaeologists, along with a detailed tomb painting depicting the board layout and playing pieces, and one sculpture depicting players playing it aboard a ship. Game scholar and designer Zach Horton recreated a speculative version of the game and it was released in two versions by Pandora Games: as a deluxe boxed Kickstarter set with Mehen and later as a standalone game. This modern reconstruction closely follows the ancient evidence and produces a unique game with a trading theme wherein players send ships out on trading missions and wager on when they will return, while manipulating them en route in an attempt to fulfill their own predictions and foils their opponents'.

The game utilizes a unique three-dimensional board, enabling playing pieces to be placed both flat on spaces and upright in grooves. This aspect has been re-created in the modern version utilizing a handmade wooden board.

On their turn, each player chooses on their turn from a number of different options, from gaining sticks to throw to obtaining movement banks that can be accumulated for later sprints, to sending a new ship off on its journey. No player “owns” any of the ships. Any player may move any combination of ships however they wish. Victory points are obtained by performing certain actions (setting sail, picking up goods, bringing goods home), as well as by correctly predicting how long a given ship will be at sea. Every time a ship sets sail, all players mark their prediction on a simple, but hidden, ledger. When a ship returns, predictions are checked against the actual results. Meanwhile, all players manipulate conditions on the board to try to make their own predictions come true!

Any number of ships can be sailed in a game, but only 5 can be on the board at any given time. Only 5 cargoes can be picked up and returned to port during the game.  Once all have been picked up, 
ships can continue to sail, but do not pick up any cargo on the Foreign Port space (though they must  still pause there).
Once all 5 cargoes have been returned to Port, the game ends.  After scoring that ship, the player with the most Victory Points wins.

Name: Home Alone: Keep the Change
Description:
Spend your holidays outwitting bandits or dodging paint cans with Home Alone: Keep the Change! In the game, you split into two teams to relive the classic story — or to see whether this time the bandits can make off with the loot!

One player is Kevin, who draws from a deck of loot and trap cards, then places them around the house. The other players are Marv and Harry, who move through the house, flipping over cards and trying to find loot (like VCRs) and avoid traps (like slippery stairs). One player can also be "Old Man" Marley, who can help Kevin fight off the bandits!

The bandits must collect enough loot and escape before Kevin's mom gets home!

—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team – Chalnath
Description:
Adherents of the Greater Good, the T'au Empire have expanded into the Vedik System, allying with the local planetary governors. Their efforts begin to unravel when an Adepta Sororitas ship arrives, and the Sisters of Battle attempt to wrest control of the system. Kill Team: Chalnath lets you take part in the guerilla battles fought between kill teams of the T'au Empire and Adepta Sororitas.

The new edition of Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team has been redesigned from the ground up as the greatest tabletop skirmish experience yet, and Kill Team: Chalnath is the perfect expansion. This incredible boxed set includes two full kill teams – trainee Adepta Sororitas Novitiates, who have yet to earn the right to wear power armour, and the high-tech special forces of the T'au Pathfinders – alongside the rules, terrain, and a new gameboard.

This boxed set includes:

1x 96-page Kill Team: Chalnath Rules Manual: Expand your sphere of operation with background for the Vedik System, plus the Adepta Sororitas and T'au Empire forces fighting within. Alongside this narrative, you'll find new rules, datacards, and background tables for both the Adepta Sororitas Novitiate and T'au Pathfinder Kill Teams, as well as a host of additional special rules and missions set in this war zone.

23x Citadel Miniatures: Two full kill teams comprised of an Adepta Sororitas Novitiate Squad and a T'au Pathfinder Squad. Each features a wide array of customisation and assembly options, allowing you to personalise your kill team, and many of the models can be assembled as multiple kinds of operatives. Both of the kill teams also come with a full transfer sheet, giving you a wide range of emblems for customising your models.

7x Terrain Pieces: Recreate the battle-scarred war zone with two large ruins and five damaged walls, representing the kind of terrain that kill team skirmishes are frequently fought across.

1x Double-sided Kill Team: Chalnath Gameboard: Engage in skirmishes on this double-sided cardboard gameboard that represents the blasted terrain of the Vedik System.

—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team – Compendium
Description:
While many kill teams, such as those of the Deathwatch Space Marines, are made up of hand-picked, specially trained warriors, others are taken from the rank and file of the galaxy’s many armies. While these impromptu operatives are often given little more than a mission description and a firm pat on the back, the harsh conditions of a killzone quickly turn them into hardened veterans in their own right.

Kill Team: Compendium is the definitive 168-page resource for bringing 19 different factions into the world of tabletop skirmish combat, featuring almost every major faction from Warhammer 40,000. From daring Tempestus Scions to disciplined T’au Hunter Cadres, armies from across the galaxy can now put forward their best and brightest to undertake dangerous missions behind enemy lines.

Inside, you'll find:


     Datacards, Ploys, and equipment for 19 factions ranging from Adeptus Astartes to Genestealer Cults
     Details about fire teams, the small groups of operatives that make up a full-size kill team
     A stunning collection of model photography and artwork featuring kill teams and their operatives


The full list of factions available in this book is as follows:
Space Marines
Grey Knights
Imperial Guard
Forge World
Ecclesiarchy
Talons of the Emperor
Traitor Space Marines
Death Guard
Thousand Sons
Chaos Daemons
Craftworld
Commorite
Troupe
Greenskins
Tomb Worlds
Hunter Cadre
Cadre Mercenaries
Hive Fleet
Brood Coven

—description from the publisher

Name: Pantacle
Description:
Each player must gather enough resources (Influence (cubes), Adepts (meeples), Powers (tokens)) to light the flames of the PANTACLE one by one. These resources can only be obtained by requesting favors from the Keepers of the PANTACLE. There are 7 types of favors that provide either resources or powers whose effects will make your progress easier. Beware though! If another player has the right set of cards in hand, they can counter your request and bribe the favor away from you.

To light a flame on the PANTACLE, players regularly need to sacrifice accumulated resources. The further players progress, the harder the PANTACLE resists and the more complex the game becomes. Indeed, a player who lights a flame receives a reward (resource, power) but also a curse, despite the sacrifice of resources. The Keepers can suspend a Curse for a time, but will the other players let them?

—description from the publisher

Name: Rumini: Hajónapló
Description:
Rumini - Hajónapló (The Logbook) is a quick and thrilling card game which brings to life the adventures of Rumini and his friends from the popular storybook series. 
 The game includes 32 scene cards, featuring some of the main characters from the book. But only 8 of these cards are used in each game; these are selected by the players using a secret drafting method, so nobody knows exactly which cards will be part of the set.
