Players are dealt character cards of lower or higher value. Each round, a scene card is flipped over. Players can play a card to the corresponding scenes in which the specific character appears. But choosing the right moment is crucial because character cards become more valuable in the later rounds! The question is whether there will be another matching scene coming up later! Otherwise, players risk penalty points for cards remaining in their hand at the end of the game.

The winner will be the player with the highest score – ultimately the one who is most successful in playing the right cards at right moment.

In the year of its release, the game was awarded the Game of the Nation 2021 (Ország Játéka) joint professional prize in family & party category, as well as the JEM Board Game Award (JEM Társasjáték Díj) in national development category by most popular Hungarian board gaming magazine JEM.


Gyors és izgalmas kártyajáték, melyben Rumini és barátai kalandjai elevenednek meg. 32 jelenetkártyát tartalmaz a játék, ezek mindegyikén néhány Rumini karakter szerepel. Minden partiban 8 jelenetkártya kerül játékba, melyet a játékosok közösen, de egymás elÅ‘tt titkosan választanak ki, így senki se tudhatja pontosan, milyen jelenetekre kell számítani.

A játékosok a karakterkártyákat tartanak a kezükben, alacsonyabb vagy magasabb pontszámmal.  Ezeket a kártyákat kell a megfelelÅ‘ jelenetekhez kijátszani – de nem mindegy, mikor! Mert ugyanaz a kártya a késÅ‘bbi fordulókban egyre többet ér, de vajon lesz-e még olyan jelenet, amelyhez kijátszható? Ha nem, akkor a játék végén büntetÅ‘pont jár.

Az nyer, aki a lehetÅ‘ legjobb pillanatban veti be a megfelelÅ‘ kártyákat, és ezzel a legmagasabb pontszámot éri el.

Megjelenésének évében máris kétszeres díjnyertes lett a Rumini - Hajónapló: családi- és partijáték kategóriában megosztva elhozta az Ország Játéka 2021-es szakmai díját, valamint a hazai fejlesztésÅ± játékok között a JEM Társasjáték Díjat a népszerÅ± magyar társasjátékos magazin szavazata alapján.

Name: APJOK Lietuvą
Description:
The witty board game "Visit Lithuania while riding the horse" is a great party entertainment and an almanac of the strangest place names. The game will make you smile and cause surprise. Here it will become clear that Vilnius is in Kupiškis district, KlaipÄ—da is a suburb of PanevÄ—Å¾ys, and Lithuania has both Foreign and its own Colony. These are funny, witty and unexpected place names of Lithuania country, which can be found on closer examination of the map.

Saddle your horse and surround your estates as the Grand Duke of Lithuania - be it MeškuiÄiai, ZuikinÄ— or Vištytis. And your horse will definitely enjoy visiting the Sheepskin, Cabbage or Horse Pastures.

On their turn, players move around the board with horse similar to a knight in chess. Player have cards in hand with places they must visit. The game ends when first player has visited all places in his  hand and returns to start/finish position. Whoever finishes first is the winner.

The board game has 3 versions of the rules: the main "Play against opponents", a team game and the "Play against the system" game.

Name: Burdaerata
Description:
This party game it´s about Venezuelan Slang!

You decide a JUDGE player to draw a WHITE card with a VENEZUELAN situation, all players play a VINOTINTO CARD (with lot of obscene slangs)  from his hand and shuffle all of them, the most hilarious one chosen by the Judge will be the winner of the round.

Played until a player gets 10 wins or when the group decide to end the game.

This game it´s the Venezuelan Ambassador of the Slang and colonialism from Venezuela (and that´s a high stake), played around the world by Venezuelans diaspora and anyone who love tropical caribbean spice!

You want to learn how to speak like a venezuelan? ¡COMPRA ESTA VAINA!

Name: The Lost Spells Card Game
Description:
The Lost Spells is a card game based on the stunning book by best-selling author Robert MacFarlane, and Illustrator of over 40 beloved classics, Jackie Morris.

As with its predecessor, The Lost Words Card Game, the game is won by pairing the Spell (poem) cards in your hands with the beautifully illustrated Nature cards before your opponent. However, the Spells in this game are only revealed when you collect the correct amount of key cards! Is your memory good enough to remember the whereabouts of your card and will it be stolen by your opponents Foxy card? The first player to collect 6 pairs of cards, wins!

Name: Machi Koro 2: Landmarks Promo Pack
Description:
This promo pack for Machi Koro 2 adds three new landmarks: the City Hall, Renovation Company, and Private Club. The new cards can simply be shuffled into the corresponding deck.

City Hall: "If you roll 1 die and receive no coins, get 2 coins from the bank. (all players)"
Renovation Company: "If you roll 6, get 1 coin from the bank for each [mug] establishment you own. (all players)"
Private Club: "Take 5 coins from each opponent who has 2 landmarks. (builder only)"

This promo pack was initially made available as a bonus for those who preordered the game.

Name: Chompin' Charlie
Description:
Roll the dice, then feed Charlie the matching colored acorn. Watch his eyelids – when they reach the top, he’s ready to pop! (the acorns will fall from inside the tree onto the table)

Grab the acorns that scatter from Charlie’s tree as fast as you can, and be the first to fill your secret stash (player card) to win!

Name: Beware of the Bear
Description:
Carefully open the door, and poke his belly to make sure he’s asleep. Did Papa stay snoozing? Whew – that was a close one! You can now take one of his goodies. But if you press your luck…Papa is going to wake up and jump out of the cave, and you’ll have to give away your goodies! If you can catch him with your ‘bear’ hands, your goodies are safe. The player with the most goodies wins the game!

Players roll a die and collect a goodie or poke the bear's belly, depending on the die roll. Play continues until the Bear's belly is poked and the release mechanism shoots the bear in the air.  The player who catches the bear keeps all their goodies; the other players lose 1 goodie.

The game ends either when the bear jumps or the goodie basket is empty.  The player with the most goodies wins.

Name: HeroQuest: Hero Collection – Commander of the Guardian Knights
Description:
Prepare for battle! The Commander of the Guardian Knights has been summoned by Mentor to join the heroes in the fight against Zargon’s evil forces. As the head of an elite cadre of noble knights, the Commander’s first responsibility is to protect their fellow heroes from the dangers that lurk behind dungeon doors and can always be found in the thick of combat, leading the way with sword sharp and shield sturdy. The Guardian Knights are the King’s finest warriors and personal guard, devoted to protecting the realm at all cost. They are models of chivalry and honor, chosen to uphold the tenets and values of the kingdom all while pushing back against the armies of Dread.
 - This HeroQuest character collection includes 2 finely-detailed miniatures and 12 game cards.
- With 3 unique powers and knight skills not possessed by any other HeroQuest character, this well-trained armored fighter is ready to stand between allies and danger, with sword and shield at the ready.
- Choose from 2 different sculpts of this Commander of the Guardian Knights hero
- Requires HeroQuest Game System to Play

Name: Duel TCG
Description:
Duel Trading Card Game is a realtime online card game where players assume the role of a powerful mage, casting spells and abilities trying to reduce their opponents HP to 0 to win the duel. There are no creatures or items allowed in the Tournament of Gods, so player’s decks that they build consist entirely of spells and abilities. Duel is realtime, meaning there are no turns and both players receive 1 Mana every 5 seconds to use to draw cards and cast spells and abilities.

Cast a spell by spending the amount of Mana listed as a gold number in the top right of the card and set the projectile sideways on one of the Spell Timers in the center of the field. Set it facing your opponents, as if it was in the air on its way to hit them. Your opponent then has 10 seconds to hit that incoming attack with one of their own, (and if the one that they use is double the ATK or more of the one it collided with it not only kills the weaker one but also continues on towards the enemy’s HP.) or use a quick-play ability such as Blink or Reflect.

Players make decks of 50 cards that have no other restrictions whatsoever, just a 50 card max, but they do also have something called a Type Mastery, which is a single type (card color) that they can cast for 1 less Mana and take one less Damage from. There’s no limit to how many spells can be used against a single incoming attack, and there’s no limit on how many can be played per turn, or how many cards players can draw per turn either, the only limit is how much Mana you have.
